task_summary: Perceive the T-block and the goal marker, approach and align, orient the circular tool, push the T-block toward the marked target, verify proximity to the goal, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop pushing task: a robotic arm with a cylindrical (circular) tool must drive a T-shaped block along the plane to a drawn target marker. The scene shows a red T-block and a blue outline target on a white tabletop. The robot first detects the block and goal, moves above and aligns to the block, orients its tool to a push-friendly yaw, and executes a straight push of moderate distance toward the goal. After motion, it checks proximity to the goal region and then retreats to a safe standoff. Visual feedback and retries are used during perception.
preconditions: T-block and target marker are visible in the camera view.
Robot and camera streams operating near 10 Hz.
Table friction sufficient to prevent uncontrolled sliding.
stepwise_plan: Detect the T-block; retry if needed.
Detect the goal marker; retry if needed.
Move above the block and refine alignment.
Set tool yaw to align with intended push direction.
Push the block a fixed distance toward the goal.
Refine alignment near the goal marker and verify location.
success_criteria: Block’s centroid overlaps the target outline within visual tolerance.
No toppling or collisions with surroundings.
Robot ends in a retracted, ready pose.
failure_and_recovery: Block not detected: rescan with retry.
Misalignment during approach: realign then reattempt push.
Insufficient displacement: perform another push cycle.
Occlusion or perception noise: pause and redetect.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the goal check passes (IsAt goal marker after refinement) or when any action times out/fails irrecoverably.

frame_3.now_evidence: Arm is co-linear with the T-block indicating completed approach/alignment.
frame_3.predicts_next: A forward push is imminent as the tool is positioned at the block’s stem.

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Move to a pre-push height above the block.
Refine lateral alignment to the block for pushing.
Orient tool to the push direction.
Refine near the goal region for verification.
Back off to a safe pose.

failure_modes: Push direction not aligned with target
Insufficient push distance due to friction
Block rotates and deviates from path
recovery_strategy: Chain multiple shorter pushes toward goal
assumptions: Frames show a red T-block and a blue target outline; instruction mentions gray block and green target—visual evidence is preferred.
IsAt(goal_marker) is used as a proxy for object-at-goal; dataset does not provide an explicit object-at-goal condition.
10 Hz observation/control is respected by the upstream system; not encoded as Wait nodes due to allowed timeout bins.

expected_success_criteria: Final image shows the T-block overlapping the goal outline with small lateral error
